data.message:
i declare again :  Hey Facebook , i remind you my position!
Today, December 2, 2014 in response to the Facebook guidelines and under articles L.111, 112 and 113 of the code of intellectual property, I, SmarTwo Dacu , declare that my rights are attached to all my personal data, drawings, paintings, photos, texts etc... published on my profile. For commercial use of the foregoing my written consent is required at all times. If Facebook brake the law ( (UCC 1 1 1-308-308-103 Of the Roma State ) i have right to ask for my desired solution, including the full erase of my database from their servers or their analog/digital data store without influencing my facebook account, deleting all the information that is or was taken from my profile for commercial use.

replies.message: Hi SmarTwo. This is a known hoax. You own the stuff you share on Facebook. To learn more you can read our terms at https://www.facebook.com/legal/terms. -Sarah
@SmarTwo The "articles" you just stated, I believe those only apply to people living in France.

If you are going to post something pretending to use "legal" terms, perhaps proper grammar should be used. You should also do some research, if you agree to FB terms and conditions when you sign up, posting something cannot override those terms and conditions.
